meanings.definition: Ready to accept something without protest.
meanings.sent1: The acquiescent student nodded silently when asked to stay after class.
meanings.sent2: She was always acquiescent to her parents' rules.
meanings.sent3: The acquiescent puppy wagged its tail happily as it followed its owner's commands.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed acquiescently, bending around the rocks in its path.
meanings.sent5: The acquiescent clouds drifted lazily across the sky, accepting the wind's gentle push.

meanings.sent1: The acquiescent child followed all the instructions without question.
meanings.sent2: He remained acquiescent in front of his boss, never challenging his decisions.
meanings.sent3: The acquiescent kitten purred contently as it was carried around the house.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood acquiescent in the face of the storm, bending but not breaking.
meanings.sent5: The acquiescent waves lapped gently at the shore, obedient to the moon's pull.

meanings.sent1: The acquiescent team members all nodded in unison to the coach's plan.
meanings.sent2: She was always acquiescent to her friend's suggestions, never wanting to cause conflict.
meanings.sent3: The acquiescent cat allowed the toddler to dress it up in doll clothes without protest.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered through the acquiescent leaves, carrying their agreement to the forest.
meanings.sent5: The acquiescent sun dipped below the horizon, giving way to the peaceful night.
